Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees pitching staff is expected to get key additions this week, as Luis Gil and Clarke Schmidt are set to return from injury.
Others: Juan Soto had an especially rough game in right field in Sunday’s 14-7 loss to the Cardinals, as he misplayed several balls.

Juan Soto: Had an especially rough game in right field, misplayed several balls in Sunday’s 14-7 loss to the Cardinals.
Luis Gil: Expected to return from injury this week and make a final minor league rehab start with Double-A Somerset.
Clarke Schmidt: Also expected to return from injury this week and make a final rehab outing with Somerset.
Aaron Judge: Went hitless and struck out three times in the game.
Scott Effross: Roughed up for two runs on three hits in just ²/₃ of an inning after returning from Tommy John surgery.
Ron Marinaccio: Also allowed two runs and a homer in his outing.
Ian Hamilton: Expected to resume his rehab assignment after being scratched due to back spasms.
Nick Burdi and Lou Trivino: Also pitching in the minors and could potentially shake up the Yankees bullpen again over the final weeks of the regular season.
